meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be moved.
meanings.sent1: The movability of the chair allowed us to rearrange the room easily.
meanings.sent2: The movability of the boxes made it simple to shift them to the new location.
meanings.sent3: The movability of the sofa turned cleaning into a fun game of furniture Tetris.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas had a certain movability, always shifting and adapting to new perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The movability of the clouds across the sky was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily transported or shifted.
meanings.sent1: The movability of the suitcase made traveling a breeze.
meanings.sent2: We appreciated the movability of the furniture when we had to move to a new house.
meanings.sent3: The movability of the shopping cart made grocery shopping much more convenient.
meanings.sent4: His words had a certain movability, easily swaying opinions in his favor.
meanings.sent5: The movability of the boat on the water was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The capacity to change position or location.
meanings.sent1: The movability of the traffic cones allowed for quick adjustments on the road.
meanings.sent2: The movability of the camera tripod helped capture shots from various angles.
meanings.sent3: The movability of the penguins on the ice rink was both graceful and comical.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts had a remarkable movability, always exploring new horizons.
meanings.sent5: The movability of the planets in the night sky was a wonder to behold.
